title: Countries Worry About US Plan to Stop Ukraine War
summary: Some countries like those in Europe, Canada, and Japan are worried about a plan from the US to end the war between Russia and Ukraine. They think the plan needs more work because it might change Ukraine's borders and limit its army, which could make Ukraine less safe. Leaders from many countries signed a statement saying borders should not be changed by force. The US plan suggests Ukraine should pull back its troops from some areas and reduce its military size. Russia might rejoin groups like the G7 if it agrees. Talks are happening in Switzerland to discuss this further. Ukraine's president says this is a very hard time for his country.

background_read: The Russia-Ukraine war started in 2022 when Russia invaded Ukraine. Many countries support Ukraine with money and weapons. A peace plan is a proposal to end the fighting. Borders are important lines that define countries, and changing them can cause problems. The G20 is a meeting of leaders from big economies to discuss global issues. Sanctions are punishments like stopping trade to pressure countries.
Article_Structure: WHO: Ukraine's allies like European countries, Canada, and Japan, along with leaders from the G20 summit.
WHAT: They are concerned about a US peace plan that could change borders and limit Ukraine's military, and they will meet in Geneva for talks.
WHERE: The concerns were voiced at the G20 summit in South Africa, and talks will be in Geneva, Switzerland.
WHY: Because the plan might not ensure a just peace and could leave Ukraine vulnerable, so more work is needed.

perspectives.description: Worried that the plan could harm Ukraine's safety and sovereignty.
Seem to support the plan as a way to end the war, with Russia seeing it as a basis for settlement.
